It’s still client side as that is were most of the editing is going to.

item.title: How to add a weapon/Armor Peice/Bonuses
item.dc:creator: @mickeymaster mickeymaster
item.description:
@mickeymaster wrote:

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:9, topic:364147”]mickey, make sure you use the “tab” key for your conventions. some of the spacing in your code was way off. and code tags are nice to bro.

example:

if (i == 7608) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 4689; class8.anInt181 = 900; class8.anInt190 = 540; class8.anInt198 = 2039; class8.anInt199 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 4690; class8.anInt200 = 4691; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.anInt164 = 4693; class8.anInt188 = 4692; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Armadyl chestplate"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A chestplate of great craftsmanship.".getBytes(); }
you should also explain renamed as well, since alot of people use project insanity these days.[/quote]Thanks least someone respects it, and yeah nah theres item.cfg and item.java.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

mickey, make sure you use the “tab” key for your conventions. some of the spacing in your code was way off. and code tags are nice to bro.

example:

if (i == 7608) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 4689; class8.anInt181 = 900; class8.anInt190 = 540; class8.anInt198 = 2039; class8.anInt199 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 4690; class8.anInt200 = 4691; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.anInt164 = 4693; class8.anInt188 = 4692; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Armadyl chestplate"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A chestplate of great craftsmanship.".getBytes(); }
you should also explain renamed as well, since alot of people use project insanity these days.

item.source: How to add a weapon/Armor Peice/Bonuses

item.title: How to add a weapon/Armor Peice/Bonuses
item.dc:creator: @mickeymaster mickeymaster
item.description:
@mickeymaster wrote:

Difficulty: 0/10

Firstly Download The Models/Ints if it is a weapon its easier!
Weapon-
Adding The Models-Place The Models Into Models Folder- Client Folder/ Models Folder
Adding The Ints- Go To Client Folder/Class8.java!
Example On What ints look like-

if(i == 11358) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want
class8.anInt174 = 11359; // Drop/Inv Model
class8.anInt165 = 11360; // Male Wield Model
class8.anInt200 = 11360; // Female Wield
class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller
class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards
class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right
class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right
class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up
class8.aString170 = “Staff of Light”; // Item Name
class8.aByteArray178 = “Humming with power.”.getBytes(); // Item Examine
}

Adding The Bonuses- Sourceside- Config/Item.cfg Ex (Item = (ID) (Item Name) (Anything Here) (Shop Prices) (Bonuses)

Real Example
item = 9765 Dragon_Crossbow OMFG_A_MONKEY_lol 750 75000 1000 0 0 0 0 106 0 0 0 0 0 0 0

Armor Peices-

Basicly the same as the weapon but item.java involved

Adding The Models-Adding The Models-Place The Models Into Models Folder- Client Folder/ Models Folder.
Adding The Ints- Go To Client Folder/Class8.java!
Armor Ints-
}
if (i == 7608) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt174 = 4689;
class8.anInt181 = 900;
class8.anInt190 = 540;
class8.anInt198 = 2039;
class8.anInt199 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 0;
class8.anInt165 = 4690;
class8.anInt200 = 4691;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt164 = 4693;
class8.anInt188 = 4692;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = “Armadyl chestplate”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A chestplate of great craftsmanship.”.getBytes();

Item.java- Sourceside/Item.java/Item - Be sure to add this armor peice in the correct area alwise it will not WORK!
Item.cfg- Sourceside/Config/Item Then add your ( Item = (ID) (Item Name) (Anything Here) (Shop Prices) (Bonuses) Save And Compile

item = 14517 Dragon_hai_top A_partially_charged_rod. 1 35 1 100 100 100 200 100 100 100 100 200 100 30 100000

AND UR DONE EASY AS THAT!
Please dont flame i was only posting this becuase people are new to coding and this is a great way to start coding thank you.!

PLEASE REMEMBER THOSE INTS WERE JUST EXAMPLES ARE NOT USABLE IF USE WISH TO ADD AN ITEM GO TO THE LINK THAT I POSTED IF USE HAVE ANY TROUBLE PLEASE SEND ME A MESSAGE http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,129.0.html
[size=12pt]PLEASE COMMENT PLEASE HAVE RESPECT I KNOW ITS EASY BUT SOME PEOPLE NEED HELP WITH THIS KIND OF STUFF.[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: How to add a weapon/Armor Peice/Bonuses
